title: [DOC] The documentation of sktime.classification.base.BaseClassifier.fit inaccurately describes the input parameters.
body:
#### Describe the issue linked to the documentation

The documentation of sktime.classification.base.BaseClassifier.fit says that it can accept a 2D np.array for X, but this doesn't work. The input is required to be 3D. Demonstrated by:

```
from sktime.classification.dictionary_based import BOSSEnsemble
import numpy as np

model = BOSSEnsemble()
X = np.random.randn(200, 10)
y = np.random.randn(200)
model.fit(X, y)
```

Produces the error:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/paul/.config/JetBrains/PyCharmCE2021.2/scratches/scratch.py", line 7, in <module>
    model.fit(X, y)
  File "/home/paul/PycharmProjects/sktime/sktime/classification/base.py", line 86, in fit
    X, y = check_X_y(
  File "/home/paul/PycharmProjects/sktime/sktime/utils/validation/panel.py", line 188, in check_X_y
    X = check_X(
  File "/home/paul/PycharmProjects/sktime/sktime/utils/validation/panel.py", line 74, in check_X
    raise ValueError(
ValueError: If passed as a np.array, X must be a 3-dimensional array, but found shape: (200, 10)
```

<!--
Tell us about the confusion introduced in the documentation.
-->

#### Suggest a potential alternative/fix

Remove
```
2D np.array (univariate, equal length series) of shape = [n_instances,
        series_length]
            or 
```
from the documentation.

<!--
Tell us how we could improve the documentation in this regard.
-->
